intro: Hieracium melaneilema, commonly known as the black-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are dark green and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium melaneilema is known for its ability to thrive in moderate climates and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
